intro: Potentilla vialis, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It thrives in full sun and is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Potentilla vialis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in garden settings for its hardiness and ability to colonize disturbed areas.
